title: Game-Based Mathematical Problem-Solving Strategies in [K-12] Education: Applying the Dota Learning Model

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational college-level mathematics (calculus, linear algebra) and understanding of game mechanics
context.additional_context: Team-based task performance utilizing real-time collaboration tools (Google Jamboard, Miro)

learning_goals: In teams of 3–4, learners divide roles to solve two multivariable optimization problems (e.g., two-variable linear programming), complete a team report (three stages: problem analysis → strategy development → verification), and presentation materials explaining the problem-solving process.
Apply game mechanics (resource management, risk assessment) to mathematical modeling
Improve problem-solving efficiency by 20% using competitive elements in real-time feedback systems
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
